Cointreau2 oz. Blanco Tequila¾ oz. Fresh Lime Juice½ oz. Fresh Pineapple Juice1 Tablespoon Kosher SaltLime Wedge, for Garnise1, 1-inch Piece of Fresh PineappleMintIcePreparationStep 1Rub the rim of the glass with a lime wedge and reserve for serving. Dip the rim of the glass into the salt and fill with ice. Set aside. Step 2Muddle the pineapple and mint in the bottom of the cocktail shaker. Add the Cointreau, lime juice, and tequila. Step 3Fill shaker with ice, cover and shake vigorously until outside of shaker is very cold, about 30 seconds. Step 4Strain the margarita through a fine-mesh strainer into prepared glass. Garnish with lime wedge. How would you rate Crushed Pineapple and Mint Margarita?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkRecipes you want to make. Cooking advice that works.
